Description: Fragmentary glazed composition small container (?); flat bottom, rounded front, maybe flat back but not preserved; one line of a hieroglyphic inscription within single line at top and bottom.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
One of faience objects from Naukratis analysed by XRF by Kazcmarczk and Hedges 1983.

The body and pale green glaze of this vessel was analysed (Vandiver 1983, C51, 285-5-680). Vandiver, P.B.F.1983, ‘Appendices’, in A. Kaczmarczyk and R.E.M. Hedges (eds), Ancient Egyptian Faience, Warminster, A1–D4.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FA.14)
